summary: This is an internal NYPD email from a detective documenting that on February 3, 2020, they were contacted by a producer from 60 Minutes Australia seeking information about the Epstein investigation. The detective provided no information and referred the inquiry to the FBI Office of Public Affairs.

persons.name: Detective
persons.context: The author of the email, a detective with the NYPD Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force, who received a media inquiry about the Epstein investigation and referred it to the FBI.

events.title: Media Inquiry to NYPD Detective
events.description: A producer from 60 Minutes Australia called an NYPD detective on their issued phone to ask questions about the Epstein investigation. The detective provided no information and referred the inquiry to the FBI Office of Public Affairs.

keyFacts: On February 3, 2020, an NYPD detective was contacted by a producer from 60 Minutes Australia regarding the Epstein investigation.
The detective was a member of the NYPD Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force, indicating their role in the investigation.
The detective provided no information to the media and directed the inquiry to the FBI Office of Public Affairs, following protocol.
The document shows continued media interest in the Epstein case in early 2020, following his death in August 2019.
The communication is an internal NYPD record documenting the media contact.
